triples.name: Autonomous agent
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a multi-layered architecture for controlling autonomous agents in dynamic environments.

triples.name: Behavior-based robotics
triples.relevance: Behavior-based robotics with reactive control is a foundational approach that the paper builds upon and improves.

triples.name: Deliberative agent
triples.relevance: The paper combines deliberative reasoning capabilities with reactive control to create a hybrid agent architecture.

triples.name: Mobile robot
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control architectures for autonomous mobile agents that can move and interact in environments.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper tackles the challenge of agent control in multi-agent worlds where multiple agents interact.

triples.name: Agent architecture
triples.relevance: The core contribution is a novel multi-layered control architecture that combines reactive and deliberative capabilities.

triples.name: Automated planning and scheduling
triples.relevance: The paper uses planning capabilities to construct and project causal models for predicting agent behavior.

triples.name: Causal model
triples.relevance: The agent constructs causal models to reason about conflicts and predict other agents' goals and intentions.

triples.name: Intention
triples.relevance: The paper uses intention inference to hypothesize other agents' goals and intentions for predictive reasoning.

triples.name: Robotics
triples.relevance: The paper addresses robotic control in the context of autonomous mobile agents operating in dynamic environments.
